Details: Two JSON arrays containing data quality rules for member data validation. Agent_1 provides 15 rules while Agent_2 provides 23 rules with more granular validation coverage. Both outputs are syntactically valid JSON with similar semantic intent but different structural approaches to rule definition.

Both outputs target member data validation with overlapping rule intentions. Core validation concepts align (NotNull, Format, Length checks) but Agent_2 provides more comprehensive coverage with additional StringLengthCheck rules and refined rule types like DomainCheck vs ValueCheck for CITY validation. Agent_1 uses MinimumRequirementCheck while Agent_2 uses ContactInfoPresenceCheck for the same business logic.

Both use identical JSON array structure with consistent object schema (Column, Rule Type, Rule Description, Severity). However, Agent_2 demonstrates more granular decomposition with separate rules per validation aspect (e.g., separate NotNull and StringLength rules for FIRSTNAME/LASTNAME), while Agent_1 combines some validations. Agent_2 includes additional rules like RangeCheck for MEMBER_ID not present in Agent_1.
Valid JSON syntax with proper array structure, consistent object schema, correct string escaping, and well-formed key-value pairs throughout all 15 rule definitions.
Valid JSON syntax with proper array structure, consistent object schema, correct string escaping, and well-formed key-value pairs throughout all 23 rule definitions.
Both outputs demonstrate perfect syntactic correctness with valid JSON formatting and consistent internal structure.

Consider adding StringLengthCheck rules for FIRSTNAME and LASTNAME to match comprehensive validation patterns. Add format validation for phone numbers and enhance COUNTRY field with NotNull constraint.

Consider consolidating related rules (e.g., COUNTRY NotNull + StringLength) for cleaner rule management. Evaluate if RangeCheck for MEMBER_ID aligns with business requirements or should be configurable.
